intro: Gnaphalon, commonly known as the white thistle, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It comprises approximately 100 species, many of which are native to Africa, Asia, and Australia. These plants typically have spiny leaves and are characterized by their purple or pink flowers. They are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Some species of Gnaphalon are used in traditional medicine for their potential health benefits.
